intro: Thesium linophyllum var. humifusum, commonly known as the low thesium, is a perennial herbaceous plant belonging to the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its low-growing habit, with prostrate stems that often root at the nodes. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, and it is adapted to grow in acidic, well-drained soils. It is native to regions of southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its unique morphology and ecological niche, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
